result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen John Tinsley

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:18 PM Defendant Allen John Tinsley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Richard S Gondik Jr in court for Allen John Tinsley.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Gondik indicates defendant will waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Asking for reschedule.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 217071,
Payable Number: 153240,
Receipt Number: 22R 014644,
Amount: $20.00
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

3:06 PM Defendant Allen John Tinsley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Gondik appears for defendant. Attorney Chad LaLor Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gondik acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts pleas. 
State requests $750 cash, no drugs or drug paraphernalia. Currently on a $5000 signature bond on a deferred case, also on probation. On a DOC hold currently. 
Attorney Gondik indicates has appeared at all prior court appearances, asks for $500 cash.
Court makes statements. Court orders $500 cash, with conditions of no possession or use of any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 11:15 am.
